Contents: b"rt @georgetown president bill clinton (f'68) returned to his alma mater to speak from the steps of old north during pre-inauguration activities in the district. #presidentsday"
Author: @HemalKVaidya
Name: Hemal K Vaidya
Post Title: RT @Georgetown President Bill Clinton (F'68) returned to his alma mater to speak from the steps of Old North during pre-inauguration activities in the District. #PresidentsDay https://t.co/BuJhebnXFQ

Contents: b'rt @georgetown in 1918, then senator warren g. harding visited campus to inspect the georgetowns students army training corps (s.a.t.c.) during world war i. here he is pictured standing with georgetown university president alphonsus j. donlon, s.j., on the steps of healy hall. #presidentsday'
Author: @GUAlumni
Name: Georgetown Alumni
Post Title: RT @Georgetown In 1918, then Senator Warren G. Harding visited campus to inspect the Georgetown’s Students’ Army Training Corps (S.A.T.C.) during World War I. Here he is pictured standing with Georgetown University President Alphonsus J. Donlon, S.J., on the steps of Healy Hall. #PresidentsDay https://t.co/CDMmaFd9Tf

Contents: b'rt @georgetown being located in washington, d.c., georgetown has often had the honor of hosting a variety of presidents on campus. for #presidentsday, we are digging into our archives to take a look back at those who have visited the hilltop.'
Author: @GKZorbas_PhD
Name: GKostrzewa-ZorbasPhD
Post Title: RT @Georgetown Being located in Washington, D.C., Georgetown has often had the honor of hosting a variety of presidents on campus. For #PresidentsDay, we're digging into our archives to take a look back at those who have visited the Hilltop. https://t.co/MXLzJsiwfm

Contents: b'in 1924, president calvin coolidge presented an honorary degree to governor william s. flynn of rhode island at the georgetown university commencement ceremony. to the left of president coolidge stands pierce butler, associate justice of the supreme court. #presidentsday'
Author: @Georgetown
Name: Georgetown Univ.
Post Title: In 1924, President Calvin Coolidge presented an honorary degree to Governor William S. Flynn of Rhode Island at the Georgetown University commencement ceremony. To the left of President Coolidge stands Pierce Butler, Associate Justice of the Supreme Court. #PresidentsDay https://t.co/IppFoZB6mo

Contents: b"beginning with george washington, many you.s. presidents have been received at old north and that tradition continued when former president gerald ford participated in the building's rededication ceremony in 1983. #presidentsday"
Author: @Georgetown
Name: Georgetown Univ.
Post Title: Beginning with George Washington, many U.S. presidents have been received at Old North and that tradition continued when former President Gerald Ford participated in the building's rededication ceremony in 1983. #PresidentsDay https://t.co/5VvqBX6NPz

Contents: b'rt @georgetown being located in washington, d.c., georgetown has often had the honor of hosting a variety of presidents on campus. for #presidentsday, we are digging into our archives to take a look back at those who have visited the hilltop.'
